Automatically relabel factor levels, collapse as necessary

Automatically relabel factor levels, collapse as necessary

fct_relabel(f, fun, ...)

Arguments

f

A factor.
fun

A function that is applied to each level. Must accept one character argument and return a character vector of the same length as its input.
...

Additional arguments to fun.

Examples

fct_count(gss_cat$rincome)
#> # A tibble: 16 × 2
#>                 f     n
#>            <fctr> <int>
#> 1       No answer   183
#> 2      Don't know   267
#> 3         Refused   975
#> 4  $25000 or more  7363
#> 5  $20000 - 24999  1283
#> 6  $15000 - 19999  1048
#> 7  $10000 - 14999  1168
#> 8   $8000 to 9999   340
#> 9   $7000 to 7999   188
#> 10  $6000 to 6999   215
#> 11  $5000 to 5999   227
#> 12  $4000 to 4999   226
#> 13  $3000 to 3999   276
#> 14  $1000 to 2999   395
#> 15       Lt $1000   286
#> 16 Not applicable  7043

convert_income <- function(x) {
  regex <- "^(?:Lt |)[$]([0-9]+).*$"
  is_range <- grepl(regex, x)
  num_income <- as.numeric(gsub(regex, "\\1", x[is_range]))
  num_income <- trunc(num_income / 5000) * 5000
  x[is_range] <- paste0("Gt $", num_income)
  x
}

convert_income(levels(gss_cat$rincome))
#>  [1] "No answer"      "Don't know"     "Refused"        "Gt $25000"     
#>  [5] "Gt $20000"      "Gt $15000"      "Gt $10000"      "Gt $5000"      
#>  [9] "Gt $5000"       "Gt $5000"       "Gt $5000"       "Gt $0"         
#> [13] "Gt $0"          "Gt $0"          "Gt $0"          "Not applicable"

rincome2 <- fct_relabel(gss_cat$rincome, convert_income)
fct_count(rincome2)
#> # A tibble: 10 × 2
#>                 f     n
#>            <fctr> <int>
#> 1       No answer   183
#> 2      Don't know   267
#> 3         Refused   975
#> 4       Gt $25000  7363
#> 5       Gt $20000  1283
#> 6       Gt $15000  1048
#> 7       Gt $10000  1168
#> 8        Gt $5000   970
#> 9           Gt $0  1183
#> 10 Not applicable  7043
